parts:
You are extracting UBX-CFG-NMEA from u-blox PDF manual pages.

**CRITICAL for talker ID fields:**
- `bdsTalkerId` is type CH (single character), NOT CH[2]
- `gpsTalkerId` is type CH (single character), NOT CH[2]

The CH type in UBX represents a single ASCII character (1 byte).
When the manual shows "2 bytes" for a talker ID, it means 2 separate CH fields, not an array.

Return using ubx_message_extraction tool.

ubx_message.name: UBX-CFG-NMEA
ubx_message.comment: This message is deprecated in protocol versions greater than 23.01. Use UBX-CFG-VALSET, UBX-CFG-VALGET, UBX-CFG-VALDEL instead. Get/set the NMEA protocol configuration. See section NMEA Protocol Configuration for a detailed description of the configuration effects on NMEA output. See the Legacy UBX Message Fields Reference for the corresponding configuration item.

bits.name: posFilt
bits.description: Enable position output for failed or invalid fixes

bits.name: mskPosFilt
bits.description: Enable position output for invalid fixes

bits.name: timeFilt
bits.description: Enable time output for invalid times

bits.name: dateFilt
bits.description: Enable date output for invalid dates

bits.name: gpsOnlyFilter
bits.description: Restrict output to GPS satellites only

bits.name: trackFilt
bits.description: Enable COG output even if COG is frozen

values.description: NMEA version 4.11 (not available in all products)
NMEA version 4.10 (not available in all products)
NMEA version 4.0 (not available in all products)

fields.name: numSV
fields.description: Maximum number of SVs to report per TalkerId.

bits.name: compat
bits.description: enable compatibility mode. This might be needed for certain applications when customer's NMEA parser expects a fixed number of digits in position coordinates.

bits.name: limit82
bits.description: enable strict limit to 82 characters maximum.

bits.name: highPrec
bits.description: enable high precision mode. This flag cannot be set in conjunction with either compatibility mode or Limit82 mode (not supported for protocol versions less than 20.01).

fields.name: gnssToFilter
fields.description: Filters out satellites based on their GNSS. If a bitfield is enabled, the corresponding satellites will be not output.

fields.name: svNumbering
fields.description: Configures the display of satellites that do not have an NMEA-defined value. Note: this does not apply to satellites with an unknown ID.

values.description: Extended - Use proprietary numbering (see Satellite Numbering)

fields.name: mainTalkerId
fields.description: Main Talker ID override. By default the main Talker ID (i.e. the Talker ID used for all messages other than GSV) is determined by the GNSS assignment of the receiver's channels (see UBX-CFG-GNSS).

values.description: Main Talker ID is not overridden
Set main Talker ID to 'GA' (not supported for protocol versions less than 15.00)
Set main Talker ID to 'GB' (not supported for protocol versions less than 15.00)
Set main Talker ID to 'GQ' (available in NMEA 4.11 and later)

fields.name: gsvTalkerId
fields.description: GSV Talker ID override. By default the Talker ID for GSV messages is GNSS-specific (as defined by NMEA).

values.description: Use GNSS-specific Talker ID (as defined by NMEA)

fields.name: bdsTalkerId_char1
fields.description: First character of BeiDou Talker ID. Sets the two characters that should be used for the BeiDou Talker ID. If these are set to zero, then the default BeiDou Talker ID will be used.

fields.name: bdsTalkerId_char2
fields.description: Second character of BeiDou Talker ID. Sets the two characters that should be used for the BeiDou Talker ID. If these are set to zero, then the default BeiDou Talker ID will be used.
